title: Projectile - speed of ball at top of path

content.question: A ball is launched from the top of a <math alttext="30 meter" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>30</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi></math> tall hill with a speed <math alttext="25 meters per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>25</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>m/s</mtext></math> directed at an angle <math alttext="40 degrees" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>40</mn><mo>Â°</mo></math> above the horizontal and lands on the ground below. Which of the following is approximately equal to the speed of the ball at the top of its path?

choices.label: <math alttext="16 meters per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>16</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>m/s</mtext></math>
<math alttext="19 meters per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>19</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>m/s</mtext></math>
<math alttext="25 meters per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>25</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>m/s</mtext></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="19 meters per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>19</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>m/s</mtext></math>

topic.text: 1.5: Motion in Two or Three Dimensions

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
